clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical and Histological Evaluation of Deproteinizated Bovine Bone Allograft and Lyophilized Equine Bone Allograft for Sinus Lift.
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Histological Evaluation of Demineralized Bone Allograft and Lyophilized Equine Bone Allograft for Sinus Lift: Double Blind, Parallel, Randomized Clinical Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: The sinus infiltration technique for sinus floor elevation has been used successfully when a reduced vertical height is available in the posterior maxilla. However, the effect of the different graft material on the volume and on the quality of new bone formed has not been fully investigated. The aim of this study is to evaluate the clinical and histological effect of a test material, lyophilized equine bone (Bio-gen®), compared with control material, deproteinized bovine bone (Endobon®), in the sinus lift techniques with lateral approach.

primary_outcome.measure: histomorphometric evaluation of new bone formation.
primary_outcome.description: The specimens will be processed to obtain thin ground sections and dehydrated in an ascending series of alcohol rinses and embedded in a glycolmethacrylate resin (Techonovit 7200 VLC; Kulzer, Wehrheim, Germany). After polymerization, the specimens will be sectioned along their longitudinal axis with a high-precision diamond disk at about 150 mm and ground down to about 30 mm with a specially designed grinding machine. The slides will be stained with acid fuchsin and toluidine blue. The histomorphometry will be performed using a light microscope (Laborlux S, Leitz) connected to a high-resolution video camera (3CCD JVC KYF55B), and interfaced to a monitor and personal computer. This optical system is associated with a digitizing pad (Matrix Vision GmbH, Brescia, Italy) and a histometry software package with image-capturing capabilities (Image-Pro Plus 4.5; Media Cybernetics Inc., Immagin, Milano, Italy).

secondary_outcome.measure: radiographic evaluation of new bone formation by measure of cbct at baseline, after surgical intervention and after 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: Three-dimensional (3D) images will be analyzed using 3D image analysis software (Nobel Clinician; Nobel Biocare AB, Gothenburg, Sweden) to assess the volume of the new space created by the implant placement and new bone formed in the sinus. The volume is expressed in millilitres. The density of the graft fraction occupied by the bone substitute and new bone formation will be determined with the digitized image system, by analysis of the follow-up CT scan. The density expressed by each type of structure and the total density will be determined from these images.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- bilateral atrophy of the maxilla;
- bone ridge <= 6mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe systemic diseas (ASA III -IV) bisphosphonate therapy or a history of up to 3 years history of radiation therapy to neck and head area sinusitis pregnancy subjects not able to consent to participate in the study.
